## Developer Guide

If you are new to using `nbdev` here are some useful pointers to get you
started.

### Install Hack3 in Development mode

``` sh
# make sure Hack3 package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to Hack3
$ nbdev_prepare
```

## Usage

### Installation

Install latest from the GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/isc-ryoung/Hack3):

``` sh
$ pip install git+https://github.com/isc-ryoung/Hack3.git
```

or from [conda](https://anaconda.org/isc-ryoung/Hack3)

``` sh
$ conda install -c isc-ryoung Hack3
```

or from [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/Hack3/)

``` sh
$ pip install Hack3
```

### Documentation

Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/isc-ryoung/Hack3)’s
[pages](https://isc-ryoung.github.io/Hack3/). Additionally you can find
package manager specific guidelines on
[conda](https://anaconda.org/isc-ryoung/Hack3) and
[pypi](https://pypi.org/project/Hack3/) respectively.
